questions.question_text: Which two capabilities do Automation script settings include? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
There is no parameters settings, its called arguments.

Selected Answer: AC
In Cortex XSOAR, an automation script is a key component that allows users to execute specific tasks and logic within their incident response workflows. The settings for these scripts typically include various options to define how the script interacts with other components within the system.

For your question regarding the two capabilities included in Automation script settings, the correct options are:

A. Define 'parameters'
C. Define 'outputs'

CD
There's no parameters, only "Arguments" which includes arguments, importants and outputs.

Selected Answer: CD
CD is correct
please provide justification/links for answers
C as in Cardi B and D as in Demisto
CD is the answer, nothing to do for inc. types.
SHOULD BE C AND D

Selected Answer: D
I use delete context =all at the start of most of my playbooks for troubleshooting. Answer is D.

Selected Answer: A
In reality, when you run DeleteContext with all=yes, it deletes all context data associated with the incident, including the incident key. This leaves the context completely empty, meaning there's nothing left in the context, not even the incident key.

A is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
The incident key prevails

comments.content: Wrong, the incident key is preserved. It's D.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/reference/scripts/delete-context

questions.question_text: After executing the DeleteContext automation with all=yes argument, how would the context data of an incident present?

choices.C: All context data, including custom incident fields will be deleted, system incident fields will remain.
choices.B: No difference, the automation cannot be executed manually.
choices.D: All context data, except the incident key will be deleted.
choices.A: All the data, including the incident key will be deleted, and the context data will be completely empty.

questions.question_text: An XSOAR engineer has been tasked with exporting all indicators from the production environment in the last 90 days. The final report needs to be in CSV format containing all indicator fields. How can this task be achieved?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-XSOAR/6.12/Cortex-XSOAR-Administrator-Guide/Export-Indicators

choices.A: Run the command !GetIndicatorsByQuery in CLI with its default arguments and export all indicators in the last 90 days.
choices.B: SSH into the server and copy the indicator's database.
choices.C: In the Threat Intel page, add query firstSeen:>="90 days ago", select All columns in Table View, and click Export to export as a CSV.
choices.D: Run the command !findIndicators in CLI with the query firstSeen:>="90 days ago" and export to CSV.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct
https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-XSOAR/8/Cortex-XSOAR-Administrator-Guide/Receive-Notification-on-an-Incident-Fetch-Error

Selected Answer: D
server config

D
https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-XSOAR/6.6/Cortex-XSOAR-Administrator-Guide/Receive-Notification-on-an-Incident-Fetch-Error

In the integration instance, ensure that you select the Fetch Incidents checkbox.
Select Settings → About → Troubleshooting → Add Server Configuration.
Add the following keys and values:
Key: module.health.notification.users
List of names in CSV format, for example
Value: user1,user2,user3.
Key: message.ignore.failedFetchIncidents
Value: false

Should be D 
https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-XSOAR/6.6/Cortex-XSOAR-Administrator-Guide/Fetch-Incidents-From-an-Integration-Instance

questions.question_text:
An administrator has noticed that an incident fetch has failed, causing several internal workflows to be backed up. The administrator would like to receive notifications the next time the incident fetch fails.

How can they achieve this?

choices.C: Schedule a job that runs and monitors incidents in XSOAR that will send an email if there are no new incidents.
choices.B: Create a new integration that monitors the incident fetch and sends an email if the fetch fails.
choices.A: Create a custom playbook that sends an email each time the fetch fails.
choices.D: Add a server config to notify when incident fetch fails.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Roles in platform
Should be D. Tested on lab options are roles all or custom roles

choices.A: Users defined in the platform (email or username)
choices.C: Users outside XSOAR via email invite
